children.label: Justice for Victims of Asbestos Related Diseases
Free Personal Care for Older People
Repealing Ban on Discussing Homosexuality in Schools
Guide to working in the sector
1. Get started
children.description: Information to help you think through some of the key issues around starting a voluntary sector organisation in Scotland.

children.label: 2. Make a plan
children.description: Developing a new voluntary sector organisation takes careful planning to map out your vision and pay attention to all the detail.

children.label: 3. Decide on membership
children.description: Membership organisations are common in the voluntary sector. You just have to choose the right kind for you.

children.label: 4. Decide on charitable status
children.description: How to understand the particular circumstances of your organisation and decide which option is right for you.

children.label: 5. Consider the risks
children.description: Consider the types of activity you will be involved in and the level of risk attached.

children.label: 6. Decide on structure
children.description: Choose the right legal structure for your organisation based on what you plan to do.

children.label: 7. Write your constitution
children.description: Once you have decided on your legal structure and are ready to draft your constitution. We’ve got models you can follow.

children.label: 8. Next steps
children.description: Register your new organisation with the appropriate body. Then get on with the business of running your organisation.

children.label: Financial responsibilities
children.description: Information on managing charity finances.

children.label: Bank accounts
children.description: Have a look at our bank account comparison table and find advice on key things to consider when choosing a bank account.

children.label: Water and sewerage exemption scheme
children.description: Find out about this scheme which is available to registered charities and community amateur sports clubs (CASCs).

children.label: Accounts & reporting
children.description: Discover the best approach to financial record keeping and reporting. Find out when an auditor is required and much more.

children.label: Tax & VAT
children.description: Information on VAT, Corporation Tax, Capital Gains Tax, Council Tax, business rates and more. We’ve also got pointers to other relevant sources of information.

children.label: Business planning
children.description: Make business planning a core activity for your management committee or trustees and your organisation will feel the benefit of clear planning and goal setting.

children.label: Organisational development
children.description: Organisational development is the name given to work that helps charities grow and change, such as quality or performance improvement.

children.label: Property
children.description: It should be straightforward for charities and voluntary organisations to buy or rent property, for their own use or as an investment, as well as to sell or lease.

children.label: Insurance
children.description: Your organisation can buy insurance to protect its money, people, property and reputation. Insurance is required by law if your organisation employs staff or operates vehicles on public roads.

children.label: Trading
children.description: Trading is an important source of funding for the voluntary sector, but it can expose your organisation to risk. So before you decide to trade, you need to carefully consider a number of questions and take advice.

children.label: Business planning
children.description: Advice on how to write a business plan and more.

children.label: Writing a business plan
children.description: A formal business plan can help your organisation establish and achieve aims and objectives. Find out what’s required depending on your legal structure and charitable status.

children.label: Risk analysis & management
children.description: Any business planning exercise needs to consider the risks of the planned activity, including the financial risks. Evaluating the risks and taking appropriate action will put your organisation in a stronger position.

children.label: Reserves
children.description: Consider appropriate arrangements for financial reserves for your organisation and understand the impact of large reserves.

children.label: Monitoring, evaluation and review
children.description: Discover how these processes can play an important role in your business planning, helping to ensure the effectiveness of your organisation.

children.label: Mergers & collaborations
children.description: There are many different ways in which voluntary sector organisations can work together, both informally and more formally. Find out how mergers and collaborations might help you.

children.label: Legislation & regulation
children.description: The legal procedures and licences you need to be aware of.

children.label: Data protection & GDPR
children.description: If you hold and process information about your clients, employees or suppliers, you are legally obliged to protect that information.

children.label: Lobbying
children.description: Find out more about the Lobbying (Scotland) Act and what it means for your organisation.

children.label: Fire safety
children.description: The Fire Safety Act places responsibility for assessing risk to those with control of any premises.

children.label: Music & film licensing
children.description: If you or people using your facilities use music for the benefit of customers, visitors or staff, you need permission from the relevant copyright owners.

children.label: Premises licensing
children.description: If you want to serve alcohol, food, or provide entertainment you will need to contact your local authority to apply for a premises licence.

children.label: Food hygiene & catering
children.description: How to provide food in a village hall or other community setting.

children.label: Health & safety
children.description: It is the responsibility of the voluntary management committee to ensure the health and safety of employees, volunteers and visitors.

children.label: PVG scheme
children.description: The PVG Scheme is a registration system for anyone who carries out work (paid or unpaid) with vulnerable groups in Scotland.

children.label: Freedom of information
children.description: Freedom of Information is a valuable resource for the voluntary sector.

children.label: Good Governance
children.description: Information for the people in management and control of your organisation.

children.label: Scottish Governance Code & checkup
children.description: The Scottish Governance Code helps trustees understand what’s involved in good governance, and is a statement of best practice specifically for the voluntary sector in Scotland.

children.label: Roles & responsibilities
children.description: Information on who can be a trustee and what’s involved. Find out about collective responsibility, personal liability and the difference between governance and management.

children.label: Recruitment & induction
children.description: Make sure you’re clear about what’s involved in recruiting trustees, as this will have an impact across your whole organisation. Once you’ve got them, make sure they get a good introduction and a comprehensive induction.

children.label: Meetings
children.description: Running effective and efficient meetings will help your organisation achieve its objectives. Find out how to set an agenda and take minutes, and ensure your trustees follow a Code of Conduct.

children.label: Developing your board
children.description: Your trustees need to continually evolve and adapt. In order to develop a problem solving approach and ensure a long-term future, you need to invest in training and development for your trustees.

children.label: Safeguarding
children.description: Information about safeguarding.

children.label: Jargon buster
children.description: Clear descriptions of common governance words and phrases.

children.label: Mediation
children.description: Don’t let things get out of hand, get help to nip conflict in the bud.

children.label: Scottish Governance Code for the Third Sector
Managing staff & volunteers
children.description: Resources to help you with HR issues and SJC pay scale information

children.label: Staff
children.description: Information on managing your organisation’s staff.

children.label: Volunteers
children.description: Advice on managing your volunteers.

children.label: Safeguarding
children.description: Information about safeguarding.

children.label: More information
children.description: Links to useful resources.

children.label: Funding
children.description: Guidance on accessing funds and information on fundraising.

children.label: Finding funding step by step
children.description: Finding your way through all the options there are for funding your organisation can be daunting. That’s why we have created a handy guide to the most important things you have to consider.

children.label: Funding Scotland
children.description: A free online search engine for funding opportunities across Scotland.

children.label: Community Capacity and Resilience Fund
children.description: Dedicated Scottish Government funding for grassroots community action.

children.label: Carers Act Transformation Support Fund
children.description: Dedicated Scottish Government funding for voluntary sector organisations involved in the local implementation of the Carers (Scotland) Act 2016.

children.label: Useful links
children.description: Help and advice from other sources.

children.label: EU exit (Brexit)
children.description: There are many steps your organisation or group can take to prepare for Brexit – contingency planning now will increase your organisation’s resilience.

children.label: KeyStone
children.description: A quality award and management toolkit for the people who manage village halls and community buildings.

children.label: How to use the KeyStone toolkit
Participation
children.description: How to deliver digital inclusion projects. Includes Connecting Scotland, Digital Participation Charter, Essential Digital Skills and Digital Champions.

children.label: Connecting Scotland
children.description: Supporting the most vulnerable to get online. We’re working with Scottish Government and partners to connect up people who don’t have the confidence, kit and connectivity at home.

children.label: Digital Participation Charter
children.description: Sign Up & Skill Up for a Digitally Smarter Scotland - any organisation operating in Scotland can sign the Charter to take a step towards becoming digitally smarter.

children.label: Essential Digital Skills
children.description: Understand how to measure essential digital skills with our toolkit.

children.label: Digital Champions
children.description: We’ve created hundreds of Digital Champions across Scotland who are making a real difference by supporting people to develop essential digital skills.

children.label: Why digital matters
children.description: One in five people lack essential digital skills. Find out why that matters to be a part of modern society.

children.label: Digital Champions - social housing
children.description: SCVO are working with several partners across the housing sector to develop a network of Digital Champions working in social housing around Scotland.

children.label: Senior Leaders Programme
children.description: SCVO are helping voluntary sector leaders grow their skills, confidence and understanding of digital opportunities.

children.label: Evolution
children.description: Creating a digitally confident third sector. Includes DigiShift, digital services, remote working, digital checkup and senior leaders programme.

children.label: DigiShift
children.description: Shift your service delivery into digital and remote channels

children.label: Risk management
children.label_full: Risk management, cyber security and safeguarding

children.label: Service delivery
children.description: An overview of some key principles behind digital service delivery, and how to guides for digital technology you may want to use.

children.label: Digital Check-up
children.description: Take our simple Digital Check-up to assess your organisation’s current digital maturity and plot a route ahead.

children.label: Essential skills
children.description: Understand and measure essential skills in your organisation

children.label: DigiHelp
children.description: Help from our digital team.

children.label: Cyber resilience
children.description: We’re working with the Scottish Government to help organisations improve their cyber resilience.

children.label: Senior Leaders Programme
children.description: SCVO are helping voluntary sector leaders grow their skills, confidence and understanding of digital opportunities.
